H0.text: Because he held the earth on his shoulders, for what Greek figure did Gerardus Mercator name his book of maps. Prometheus

H1.text: Because he held the earth on his shoulders, for what Greek figure did Gerardus Mercator name his book of maps. Hercules

H2.text: Because he held the earth on his shoulders, for what Greek figure did Gerardus Mercator name his book of maps. Gaia

H3.text: Because he held the earth on his shoulders, for what Greek figure did Gerardus Mercator name his book of maps. Atlas

A4.text: Gerardus Mercator named his work 'Atlas Sive Cosmographicae Meditationes' using the word 'Atlas' as a dedication specifically to honor the Titan Atlas, in his capacity as King of Mauretania.

A5.text: A common misconception today is that Atlas was forced to hold the Earth on his shoulders, but Classical art shows Atlas holding the celestial spheres, not the terrestrial globe.
